monogr.title: Certain Learned and Elegant Workes
monogr.author: Brooke, Fulke Greville, Lord
monogr.note: old calf, last leaf soiled. As usual this copy commences at p. 23. It is conjectured that the absent pages consisted of "A Treatise on Religion" which wasc cancelled by order of Laud—Bible. Anglo- Poetica.

monogr.title: Workes. Another copy
monogr.author: Brooke, F. G. Lord
monogr.note: calf, rebacked, M.S. notes, piece of title torn off. This book came out of the library at Sion . . . . The notes are tha handwriting of Philip Earl of Pembroke, who was used to scrawl and spoil his books in this manner.

monogr.title: Memoir of Edward Calvert, Artist

monogr.note: one of 350 copes, portrait and reproductions from his paintings, buckram, uncut, presentation copy from the author to Swinburne, with inscription
